website_summaries.verdict: A well-priced and efficient cordless reciprocating saw that's perfect for use in smaller spaces.
pros: Adjustable speed trigger for a smoother cut
Incredibly lightweight and compact design makes it easy to work in areas with limited space
Quick and easy tool-free blade changing
cons: Best for small/household jobs, not larger jobs
Battery and charger must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: 1 upset pregnant wife and 1 reciprocating saw = One destroyed shrub
customer_reviews.text: My wife is been fixated on getting rid of this ridiculous shrub in our backyard since the day we moved into our house. So I'm at work and my wife, Who is nine months pregnant by the way, sends me a photo of a massive pile of branches. Apparently, my Porter cable 20 V Max saw all came in and she decided to destroy the shrub in the backyard... Needless to say, there is no longer a shrub in our backyard. The pregnant wife is very happy! And I am happy that the saw did a fabulous job at destroying the shrub. If my nine month pregnant wife can operate this thing anybody can!
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: Updated
customer_reviews.text: I have cut a lot with this and it is still cutting strong. It's loud and vibrates pretty much but does the job and was priced right, not overly priced like DW MW MK, you know. I am dropping 2 stars because after a year it started getting real hot and had a funny smell and next time I went to use it it didn't work anymore. I could get it to go but then it would slow down or stop. It didn't last long enough even for the cheap price. I threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: remoman

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for heavy/contractor grade use
customer_reviews.text: Like the brushless drill I reviewed, same to this. I bought it for light duty and it seems to serve well. These PC power tools are made with mostly plastic, thus if you dropped it or used it a lot you might be disappointed. On one project pruning tree branches, I noticed it was getting hot and kinda knew how far to push it.. But I did know from reading multiple reviews on and away from Amazon sites, how this Sawzall performs and its intended use. I do own multiple PC power tools and plastic design and light maybe moderate is the normal expectation. Remember on average in these cases, "Good" or low price = questionable quality and life span.
customer_reviews.author: wmcc1

customer_reviews.title: Grate tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was really torn between 3 and 4 stars. I think for the most part this is a good tool. The blade change is tool less quick and easy. It is powerful enough to cut off hardened steel bolts, and 6 inch diameter branches with no problem WITH the right blade. The only problem I have, and the only reason I didn't give it a higher grade, is because the blade is a bit sloppy in the tool.
customer_reviews.author: David Derfus

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, B&D battery made to work with this saw!
customer_reviews.text: I already had five Black and Decker 20v Max Lithium tools so I thought I would try the trick that I saw on YouTube and modify this tool and one of my B&D batteries to work together and it worked perfectly. I had looked at the B&D saw but this one certainly feels superior and the reviews agreed. Therefore, I beat the B&D bean counters and market guys (who also own Porter-Cable) at their attempt to force me to buy PC batteries for this one tool. I feel like a winner here! So why didn't I buy PC tools to begin with? Because they do not offer the 20v Max garden tools that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdog

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly powerful
customer_reviews.text: The older you get the more you appreciate a light power tool with no cord. With a larger 4 amp hr battery (I do not recommend the standard battery due to the power this tool needs) and a Bausch 9 inch pruning blade I was not disappointed in the performance. Cutting through tree branches three and 4 inches around was like a hot knife through butter. 7 inches around you could tell the sawzall was underload but still only takes something like 45 seconds to a minute and 15 seconds to cut through.
customer_reviews.author: mm1

customer_reviews.title: 100 feet away from electric source not a problem just saw away
customer_reviews.text: Have always wanted a reciprocating saw but never could justify one, especially a corded one. Then after obtaining the Porter Cable 20V battery operated drill and battery packs I saw their reciprocating saw worked with the same batteries. Now that I purchased it I have found many uses for it and it is so handy without worrying about extension cords. It has come in very handy in pruning trees on the property.
customer_reviews.author: Jiggin Jay

customer_reviews.title: Better than my 12" batt oper chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Lite weight, easy to use, change saw blades in seconds, no oil required. NOW THE BEST STUFF!!!! Will cut a 3-4" root in the dirt and your not damaging the blade. I use it to cut, trees 4", pvc up to 4:", metal Flat and pipe so far 2". I can grab a low hanging limb with my left hand and cut it off with the saw in my right hand. It comes in a carrying case. I put another batt, 2-3 wood blades, 2-3 metal blades, 2 pruning blades (12" long) No pull, No prime, No oil. Also - I have bought 3 combos (Combo offer - Saw and drill) Obviously I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Scottster

customer_reviews.title: Good for light-medium duty...
customer_reviews.text: Good for light to medium duty. Versatile and can be used one handed. Lightweight but not too lightweight. Buy the big battery, especially if you have other tools in the set and the power will last a good long while. Plenty for your average homeowner. Of course it’s not quite as powerful or as durable as a commercial corded saw and it’s not meant to replace that, but will still but useful for many jobs, professional or domestic. Yeah, this whole porter line looks like toys but I use them a lot. I also like the tooless quick change blade system.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Blickstein

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and just enough saw for the average DIYr
customer_reviews.text: Looked at several other name brands including DeWalt, Rigid, and Milwaukee but they were nearly double the price of this unit. I have the P/C hex driver and it has driven thousands of 2 1/2" and 3" deck screws without any issues so was pretty sure the reciprocating saw would be similar quality. Besides it's nice when all your tools can share the same 20V battery. No complaints so far but in my experience, only time will tell how long it'll last as compared to one of the more expensive brands.
customer_reviews.author: Wado

customer_reviews.title: Cutting a Breeze
customer_reviews.text: I rated this only a 4 right now because I haven't used it much yet. I have major bathroom remodel coming up in the early spring of 2020 and it will get a major workout there cutting through backer-board and 1" thick plywood to remove a floor. I have tried it with the bigger 4amp battery and it seems to cut anything the blade can grab. I've cut nails in lumber and ripped through 4x6's like nothing. Love the fact I'm not attached to a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald M.

customer_reviews.title: NO sawdust getting into the gears and motor
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight for reciprocating saws. Can easily cut tree branches, limbs, and trunks one handed non-stop for over an hour with a 5 AH battery. Main feacher and reason I bought it besides the light weight was that the piston is SEALED at the blade end by a flat very easy to clean polymer housing. All other brands but one have an open piston shaft in the housing end into the motor and gears, NO WORRIES ABOUT SAWDUST OR METAL CHIPS GETTING INTO THE GEARS AND MOTOR THROUGH THE OPEN PISTON SHAFT AND GUMMING UP THE WORKS. Very easy to install and remove blades.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Was good for maybe a year
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after a year. I wouldn't say that I am a heavy user but not light use. I'd say I used it for 30 minutes to an hour each week. I have 4 batteries and this tool will not run for more than 5 seconds out of no where. My circular saw and drills work all day with the same batteries. I just feel that the quality of it's inners are not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tools
customer_reviews.text: I have had 4 porter cable saws. I abuse them a lot. Even though I had to return this one because it didn’t work it’s the first time I have had a porter cable tool fail me before I was able to abuse it at work. I will keep buying porter cable tools as long as they keep selling them. I just wish Lowe’s still stocked them all instead of their now small selection after craftsman started being sold
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've purchased. The first one expired after attempting to use it for hours non stop without giving it a break. That said... This is a LIGHTER DUTY tiger saw. It works wonderfully... But again.. It is LIGHTER DUTY. As long as you use it for short spurts and allow it to cool down between uses, it works great. It's versatility as a cordless tool makes it worth the slight consideration of not trying to use it like a high grade corded commercial version. I recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: The saw did everything I asked it to do
customer_reviews.text: I used the sawsall the next day it did everything I asked it to do l have a big battery that l use with my drills and after reading reviews l only made so many cuts and recharged it. I was cutting 1/4 steel plate and had no problems l also had to cut a l"plpe off and did so with no problems l believe this is a good product and cost was reasonable
customer_reviews.author: Sunpav

customer_reviews.title: I do not treat this saw very nicely. It is oilfield tough!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a sawzall (110v) for years but always had the welding machine for juice. Big hassle. Now I'm in modern times and carry 3 or 4 20v. LiPo batteries, (high capacity, modded B&D 20v). I cut everything from dead tree limbs to sucker rods. I cut this saw no slack. I bought it used from Amazon Warehouse over 4 years ago for dirt. A CERTIFIED NO-BRAINER!
customer_reviews.author: JohnDM90

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I get one sooner?
customer_reviews.text: We have a small farm and a lot of work is done outside the range of electricity. I never thought battery operated saws had much power so I ignored them. I did some work with a friend and he had a battery operated reciprocating saw. I was impressed and bought this one because our batteries fit it. WOW! It is an absolute go to tool! It s got the power, speed and battery life. I also like the easy blade lock.
customer_reviews.author: John  & Mary Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tool.
customer_reviews.text: I have other porter cable tools, batteries and charger and added this bare tool. It is one of my favorite and most versatile tools. I use it most often with Lenox 6W6R 4.2mm pruning blades. It covers anything a lopping shear can do and can easily handle 2" branches. Also, my wife finds it easy to manage in the garden pruning larger shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K.

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Attractively made
customer_reviews.text: I have three reciprocating saws one corded two battery powered. This is similar to my older saw as it goes through the battery pretty quickly, much more quickly than a drill or impact driver. These saws just require more power. They are adequate for casual tree trimming or a quick saw job; For a serious demo the corded saw is the hot ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford H. Campen

customer_reviews.title: and I love it. Decided to go with this one because ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first cordless reciprocating saw that I've owned, and I love it. Decided to go with this one because I own the matching impact driver - uses the same batteries. It does seem to burn through the batteries pretty quick. I was able to cut through 5, 4x4 treated posts, before having to swap out the battery. This is a very powerful saw, and so far, it hasn't let me down.
customer_reviews.author: W C Genzer

customer_reviews.title: Its any bodies guess.
customer_reviews.text: When I was a kid my day always bought porter cable. So I bought this saws all. It worked for a hour than started to stop and go. So i don't know if its defective or if the quality has changed for the worst. But I sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, some nice features, no issues after two months now.
customer_reviews.text: Working great for 1x2's and 1/4" plywood so far. Rips right on through. Not much slow speed control, ramps-up quickly with plenty of power. I bought the brad-gun first, then bought this since I had a battery already. Build quality is quite good. Nice and lighweight Trigger lockout for safety is smart. Quick-release chuck is nice design; no tools necessary. I can see some fruit tree pruning in this puppy's future!
customer_reviews.author: Rosso

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I had the drill and impact driver for years now and finally added this on. It’s a nice design and very maneuverable in tight spots. With the small battery it has enough life for quick jobs. I don’t see this as a pro grade tool but for quick projects or fixes, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Porter Cable Guy
customer_reviews.text: I think in the last ten years I have purchased all the 20v Porter Cable items and all are still running today! This reciprocating saw works great and with the big batter pack I was able to trim back a tree with up to 3 inch branches. I think the Porter Cable items are a great medium duty tool set and only wish they would add on to their current tools.
customer_reviews.author: oboltyo

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that I bought this to cut PVC pipe for sprinkler repairs, but the blade that came with it is obviously not for that. Vibrated all my fillings out, without more than scratching the pipe. Nice piece of hardware, but not easy to operate without using both hands.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT value for the homeowner and I have put it through it’s paces. I cut 5” roots, 6x6 beams, 3/4” re-rod without a problem. I love the tool-less fitting for blades. Not sure a professional would be ok but I can vouch for all my Porter Cable tools
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, priced right, durable.
customer_reviews.text: These porter cable tools are outstanding in their class. They are inexpensive and tough. As a contractor I used these for years. Don't be fooled, these are not comparable to the new Milwaukee fuel series, which are triple the price, but they great for regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Phil M.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After all the reviews and already owning porter cable 20v products I thought this would be a perfect replacement for my harbor freight corded sawzall.... Well this couldn't even cut a 1x4 without slipping and stopping. Happened on full batteries too. Maybe I got a bad one, and might try a replacement one, but that's my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: it's broken it won't hold the blades and that's a lot of money to waste to have to go replace it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this For my husband for Father's Day and it already broken it will not hold the blades in I wouldn't recommend buying it I'm not happy spent a lot of money on this and it's garbage I got a lot of Porter-Cable tools never had this problem before I'm just very unhappy with this product not even 6 months old and doesn't work right
customer_reviews.author: Della

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine have no complaints except for the blade that comes with is junk . I don't work for Diablo but maybe I should every tool I've owned in The last 5 years I buy Diablo blades for have never been let down other than that the stools fine just get a different blade.
customer_reviews.author: Wes simpson

customer_reviews.title: perfect addition to my Porter Cable set
customer_reviews.text: I have been needing a portable version of my big corded sawsall, and this one does that perfectly. Its cut tree branches, rope tied around a bush hog, and a rolled up carpet so far. Its very nice to have the 20v power and portable tools. Highly recommend it. And if your interested, Yes it will bend up the blades just like the plugged in version.
customer_reviews.author: A. different Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Watch battery life
customer_reviews.text: It is a little under powered compared to an electric one and that's with a full charge. And as the battery runs down so does the speed of the saw . But it's a great saw for what I need it for quick and easy for small jobs without having to lug a dropcord or with places with no electricity and having to bring a generator.
customer_reviews.author: Danny R. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the price
customer_reviews.text: Worked well while it worked but it broke about a month into using it. I understand it's cheap and I'm not bad, I'll probably buy another one in the future. We use our tools a lot on the farm and this thing did impress me consistently
customer_reviews.author: Tobi

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, but not very durable. It broke on my first project. I was using it to tear down a sheet metal shed. It was very tough work to be fair. Apparently the sheet metal caught on the blade locking mechanism and destroyed it. Thankfully Amazon took it back no questions asked. If you are just using this for simple cutting work, it will likely be fine. If you need it for heavy duty demo, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Mean cutting machine
customer_reviews.text: The Porter Cable 20 volt reciprocating saw is a mean cutting machine. It seems to have nearly the power of my old corded Tiger Saw. I have the black PC batteries which don't have a long run time. If using this saw a lot, the higher capacity batteries would be better. For small jobs, this saw and the black batteries work well. I love the tool-free blade changing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: May try another one
customer_reviews.text: This should’ve been a great product maybe hit or miss on manufacturing time Chuck would not hold Blade. Thank goodness bought on Amazon easy return may try to purchase another one and see if the manufacturing is better
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: This is the best battery powered saw zal's i have ever used it last a long time on battery charge and with a good blade it cut's right thru tree branches or wood or metal with metal blade. Blade is very easy to change.Makes life easy not having to drag a cord around or looking for power.Porter cable has always been quality tools for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ray G

customer_reviews.title: Smokes after 3rd use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second PC product that has quit working or smokes and smells like burnt plastic after light use. I have used this saw only 3 times and after a few seconds of use, it quits working and starts smoking. Had to give a star but Amazon needs a thumbs down button. Spend the extra money and get a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kim T.

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw to add to the PC 20V lineup for a homeowner. While building a new fence, we discovered that a tree had actually grown through the old fence and needed to be removed. After cutting it down (trunk was too large for anything but a chainsaw), this saw with a 9 inch pruning blade made short work of cutting the tree into manageable pieces. I would recommend that you have a 4 Ah battery for this saw if you're doing more than a few short cuts, as it does use more energy than the other tools in the PC 20V line.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Buy a big battery and enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. Had to buy a larger capacity battery but well worth it with that battery ( The smaller batteries that came with my drill wouldn't last a few minutes with this. Aftermarket battery lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: I've just tried this piece on a few branches of an old lilac, about 1" to 1-1/2" in diameter, but I am thrilled with its performance, so far. Cuts like a champ, easy to handle and I now own a reciprocating saw, right up there with a machine gun as a little boy toy. Not allowed a machine gun but this thing should be useful around the house and property and fits nicely between a saber saw and a circular saw. Note in passing, I did not read closely enough so received the bare tool with no battery. Works great with a battery. Did I mention, no cord?
customer_reviews.author: wild bill

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is much better than expected. I purchased it because I already had the Porter Cable drill/circular saw combo. Disassembling pallets was my main reason for this saw. It ran right through the pallets and every other job I threw at it. It's lightweight and very quick on blade changes. I did not expect this much power from an electric reciprocating saw, but I have yet to be disappointed. If you already have the Porter Cable 20v battery then this is a great addition to your tools.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Cook

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power, and light enough to stave off fatigue
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time just now, and it is a pleasure to work with. It's far lighter than the Bosch plug-in recip saw it's replacing (going on 30 years old, as far as I can remember, so no complaints) which just stopped working. I bought a 2-pack of 5 AH batteries () to power it. One battery lasted through the 1/2 hour job cutting through one 4-inch and one 3-inch iron pipe and still wasn't dead. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Turbo

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my cordless tools
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw, I use it for pruning as well as other outside jobs. Battery is acceptable just using standard type but would suggest the larger one if using for extended periods .
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool with tremendous versatility
customer_reviews.text: It makes a fabulous landscape tool . You can't climb up a palm tree with a chain saw . It looked cactus with ease but I sometimes wish for a longer blade to avoid the stickers!!! At 83 I appreciate it's lightness!
customer_reviews.author: lar/jane

customer_reviews.title: Best saw ever!!
customer_reviews.text: My first one was a gift and once I started to use it, I use it for everything! Wood, pruning, metal, brush. After several years, I finally wore it out -- the blade locking mechanism broke -- so I HAD to have a new one. It is powerful, safe to use, and recharges quickly. I LOVE this saw!!! FYI I'm female 60+ years :-)
customer_reviews.author: ChersGroupie

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: The part about this tool is it is light, and my wife has small hands and she can use it too.. Make sure you spend the money on two batteries if you are working it hard you are going to need to keep switching them out.. If I'm doing demo I still use my other one that has a cord but over all great tool
customer_reviews.author: David Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great for clearing bamboo fast
customer_reviews.text: Assuming its durable, and Porter Cable has been in the past, its the easiest reciprocating saw to use. Light weight and I can carry in my belt with a home made holster and its doesn't weigh me down. Great for clearing bamboo fast. You do need your own battery but if your battery powered tools are Porter Cable then you are already set up to go.
customer_reviews.author: John P Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Battery life seems normal and as far as maneuverability and versatility is concerned, it's the same as the rest of the tools in this class. I've always been a fan of Porter Cable tools.
customer_reviews.author: D. Prentice

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this saw! Ive used it to cut off dozens of dead branches around the house. It does chew through batteries so you need to buy the larger capacity ones to really hog through wood. It comes with one universal type blade, I would highly recommend buying a pack of better ones for your specific application.
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Vibrates ALOT well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool!! The only drawback I have to report is it vibrates ALOT. Like it’s kinda hard to hold with one hand. Other than that great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Erikka M.

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: I have lot of Porter cable tools & Lowes doesn’t keep a good inventory of PC since they are pushing Craftsman. Glad Amazon has these tools at a fair price
customer_reviews.author: Jan Tonkin

customer_reviews.title: My first protable saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first saws all tool. I got it mainly because I already have a 20 volt lithium battery for my Porter Cable drill and the versatility a portable tool offers. It works great to saw the antlers off your less than trophy buck! I recommend getting the Demolition blades for all around use. It has already made several jobs much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Norval  E. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: If you already have PC 20V tools, it's GREAT.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice light to medium duty tool. If you already have a 20V Porter Cable tool then this is a great add on. Does not come with any batteries or charger. Under powered and too short of a duty cycle for a contractor, but a GREAT tool for weekend projects and intermittent tasks. Everything feels tight. Cuts where I want.
customer_reviews.author: BionicPenis

customer_reviews.title: Good value if you already have a battery with another Porter-Cable tool
customer_reviews.text: I had a P-C drill and two batteries so this was a no-brainer. Not heavy duty job site tool but good for the handyman around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Garren

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Porter Cable 20V impact driver set, batteries are the same for both. Has good power and does come with 1 blade in the box!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: this is a great little saw
customer_reviews.text: this is a great little saw. I bought it to cut out some small trees on our property. It works well with the pruning blade, but it burns through the battery pretty fast, (dead battery after cutting ten, 2 inch cedar trees). I will use this a lot for other projects though.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie  OKC

customer_reviews.title: Yep.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it should. Easy to use. It does suck up the battery, but as long as you either have a back up charged or are not taking down an entire house it will do just fine.

customer_reviews.title: Good for around the house projects.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, as it uses the same battery I use on my drill. It is strong enough for trimming trees and such. Haven't done much more with it, but I'd expect decent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce K. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband.He already had the battery and charger.Using it to cut up our old hot tub.He said it cuts like butter.Better then chain saw or grinding wheel.A good tool makes any job easier
customer_reviews.author: sandra brooks

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought the drill and the impact driver, and decided to purchase this to go with them. I wish it had come with a battery but they are available. It's a very nice saw. It fits my hands and it's stable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Its a great saw.  Lightweight and powerful.  It does come with an all purpose blade.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great saw. Lightweight and powerful. It does come with an all purpose blade. Used it to work on a fencing project and to cut up large branches and small trees. Looking forward to not having to deal with an extension cord for small to mid size wood cutting projects
customer_reviews.author: R B Miller

customer_reviews.title: BADA$$ Tool!!
customer_reviews.text: Another GREAT tool from PORTER-CABLE. I was tasked, by my wife, to drywall our laundry room. Let's just say, there were a few obstructions. This tool did everything I needed it to do and more. I must admit that I was a bit skeptical when I first started, but this tool proved it's worth every penny. If you're doing demolition of any sort and don't want to think about where you will plug it in, GIVE THIS TOOL A SHOT!!
customer_reviews.author: VikingSailor

customer_reviews.title: Yes, I like them
customer_reviews.text: I use these things like crazy.... I've burned a TON of these at work but I abuse them beyond what they were designed for. I keep using/abusing/buying them because they are light, fast, comfortable and I have lots of battery packs for them. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Denver_luvn

customer_reviews.title: A saw worth owning
customer_reviews.text: I have run this saw hard and long, in nasty spots twisting and in hot attics. The smaller body is really handy in tight spots. The blade lock has not failed and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a friend of mine that was no quit sure but now that he has it thinks its the greatest tool he has in his scrapping business.
customer_reviews.author: Ladd H

customer_reviews.title: Great tigersaw at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power, light and small. If you need a tigersaw and have Porter Cable products already that use the 20v battery, get this. You will not be dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for trimming tree branches and saplings that are below dirt level. Works well with a Freud pruning blade.
customer_reviews.author: M L G

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I decided to go 20v li-ion after ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I decided to go 20v li-ion after my 10 year old Dewalt 18v set batteries died. I could have spent $100 on new Dewalt batteries, but those tools are so heavy for my weak wrists. These are way lighter and feel so much better in my hands than the Dewalt and have worked great. I wish I had got this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping works great
customer_reviews.text: works as good as the blade and battery you use with it....holding up very well no complaints great product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Van Horn

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Hass to be one of my favorite battery tools. I used it to prune trees around my tree stands and around the house(I bought the wood pruning blade) and this little thing has yet to disappoint. A really good value for your dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin S

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Impressed on how well it works. Plenty of power and with extended life battery is a hard working tool. Time will tell on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: sam carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Great portable saw!
customer_reviews.text: Great item! Lightweight and easy to use! Cuts very well. Make sure you have a spare battery.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Warkenthien

customer_reviews.title: A MONSTER
customer_reviews.text: THIS TOOL IS A DEFINITE "MUST"...........IT HAS "MULTIPLE" USES AND VERSATILITY!!! CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT IT....I HAVE BOUGHT 2 AND THEY ARE TRULY FANTASTIC!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: howie77

customer_reviews.title: Got for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for some light demo in the kitchen. It was great not dealing with a cord but it wasn't great at getting through 2x4s when they start to pinch. It cut through nails like a boss which is the actual reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Quality power tool
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact size and has enough power to get the job done. Has a nice feel to it.
customer_reviews.author: Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the collection
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when you don't want to have 3 or 4 different brands of power tools
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Light
customer_reviews.text: Powerful for battery. It does get hot. Not great for a person using for multiple multiple cuts
customer_reviews.author: Jay N.

customer_reviews.title: Good power
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with Porter Packard. Has been better than Milwaukee or Ryobi
customer_reviews.author: Brenda T.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.  No battery.🙁
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Cuts through anything. Charge last a long time. You need to sell these tools with a battery. I have too many tools to run off 2 batteries and new ones are way too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Great on the go
customer_reviews.text: Works great, super handy being cordless. Not sure how long the battery will last on a full charge and not stop use. I am constantly switching my battery between this, a drill, and grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw, easy to use, plenty of power, good durability and very light. So far used it to cut an 8lb sledgehammer head in half
customer_reviews.author: Drew L

customer_reviews.title: The 'tool only' tools are a real bargain once you have batteries and charger.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first battery reciprocating saw and it exceeded my expectations. It was particularly useful for trimming trees with a prunning blade.
customer_reviews.author: Brad McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. I love the 20v lithium tools by porter-cable.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter80

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: nice to have now I'm cutting sh!t left and right......including some necks..... great tool
customer_reviews.author: onesinabluemoon

customer_reviews.title: Great cordless recip saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good recip saw- definitely a lot of bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Kdub

customer_reviews.title: I like
customer_reviews.text: Man this tool is just wow!!! It kicks ass on any job I put it up too .well worth buying one to any one for all types of jo😄
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this saw
customer_reviews.text: have only used this saw a couple times but it works very well
customer_reviews.author: glen

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This lithium Porter Cable tool , works very well . Be careful of its power . Hope the battery life i s extended , like it power .
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Works good for cutting wood but when I went to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Works good for cutting wood but when I went to cut conduit I couldn't do it like the other porter cable saw zaw there's a space in between the body and the blade that moves so you can't hold it still while holding the conduit unless you flip the blade
customer_reviews.author: Kris Lunney

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty powerful little saw.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this saw with a pruning blade to trim back some bushes and 2" to 3" branches. It is working rather well.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Put a Diablo blade on this and it ran right through two 4x4s like butter, clean cut as well! No issues yet!
customer_reviews.author: 18thstreetstyle

customer_reviews.title: Blade does not move, Motor just spins
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item about 4 months ago, I only used it about 3 times doing light cutting on tree branches. Last time I used it the motor would just spin. I like porter cable 20 volt tools but this saw was a real lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through 1/2" schedule 40 steel pipe
customer_reviews.text: This tools cuts like the electric model and does well on battery life. This was a nice purchase for me. I get tired of stringing extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Well Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Battery dont seem to last as long as other brands
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Wehrle

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as you would expect quite maneuverable and Light
customer_reviews.author: marc c adrian

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw to cut out shooting lanes on my hunting property. It does the job very well and quickly. Buy a tree trimming blade and you are in business. Much faster than the pole saw I used to use. Worked so well my brother said he was going to get one to do the same thing. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: K. P.

customer_reviews.title: not impressed with the power
customer_reviews.text: I use the original porter cable large battery on this say and it dies very quickly. Not to sure if its the saw or the battery. But I am really not impressed
customer_reviews.author: stephen mathison

customer_reviews.title: not too of the line but next best for the average or a little above
customer_reviews.text: It's porter cable, not best of the line but next best for the average or a little above. All my pc tools are great so far. This is about 10 lbs though, not 5 as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Mythic

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE 20V MAX Reciprocating Saw, Tool Only (PCC670B)
product_meta.description: The PORTER CABLE PCC670B 20v MAX Lithium Bare Reciprocating Tigersaw features a high herformace drivetrain that delivers 1" stroke length and 0-3,000 SPM for aggressive cutting speed. The compact design allows tool to reach tight spaces at only 14.5" in length and the tool free blade release allows for quick and easy blade changes. A variable-speed trigger provides more control for cutting a variety of materials and the pivoting shoe helps keep constant contact with material. It has a contoured overmolded handle that is optimized for increased comfort. This tool is part of the 20V Max System - a high performance cordless platform. (This is a bare tool item - battery sold separately).
feature_bullets: High Performace Drivetrain delivers 1" stroke length and 0-3,000 SPM
Compact design allows tool to reach tight spaces
